author: James Gorman
title: Sydney recycling centre blaze expected to burn all night - 9news.com.au
text:
Sydney recycling centre blaze expected to burn all night By James Gorman 
A factory fire in Sydney’s west that shrouded the city with a plume of black smoke is expected to burn all night. 
The area around the Waste Service Recycling plant on Muir Road, Chullora in Sydney’s west was evacuated this morning. More than 100 firefighters are still working to contain the blaze after receiving an emergency call at 9.21am. 
A NSW Fire and Rescue spokesman told 9NEWS a remote control water cannon had been sent inside the smouldering factory to help cool down sections of the site currently inaccessible to firefighters. Smoke from the Chullora fire can be seen from as far away as Sydney Harbour. 
Emergency crews have contained the fire to the burning building which is full of paper, cardboard and plastic. The fire is expected to burn all night, NSW Fire and Rescue said. 
The fire had earlier been upgraded from an “Alarm Eight” to an “Alarm 10” due to the size of the blaze and issues accessing water A huge plume of smoke from a waste recycling centre fire. (Twitter: Ben Gorman‏@benjamin_g1980) 
All workers in the plant have been evacuated and accounted for. © Nine Digital Pty Ltd 2017
